official-title.#text: To require the Comptroller General of the United States to submit a legislative proposal to Congress to reorganize executive branch agencies, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

committee-name.#tail: , for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

short-title.#text: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Requirement for Comptroller General to submit legislative proposal to reorganize executive branch agencies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit one legislative proposal to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , with a copy transmitted to the
at the same time, to reorganize executive branch agencies in order to achieve the following:

text.#text: The
A decrease in the total number of Federal agencies that promote American competitiveness, exports, and businesses, in order to improve and simplify support and services for American businesses.
Cost savings in the performance by the Federal Government of support and services for American businesses.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit the legislative proposal required by
not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:2/ss:a

In this Act, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be referred to the committee with jurisdiction over the subject matter concerned. A bill described in
introduced in the Senate shall be referred to the committee with jurisdiction over the subject matter concerned. An amendment to the bill is not in order in the committee in either House.

text.#text: A bill described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is referred has not reported such a bill (or an identical bill) by the end of the 20-day period beginning on the date on which the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: submits the proposal to the
under
, such committee shall be, at the end of such period, discharged from further consideration of such bill, and such bill shall be placed on the appropriate calendar of the House involved.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:2

text.#text: If the committee to which a bill described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) from further consideration of, such a bill, it is in order (even though a previous motion to the same effect has been disagreed to) for any Member of the respective House to move to proceed to the consideration of the bill. A Member may make the motion only on the day after the calendar day on which the Member announces to the House concerned the Member’s intention to make the motion, except that, in the case of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the motion may be made without such prior announcement if the motion is made by direction of the committee to which the bill was referred. All points of order against the bill (and against consideration of the bill) are waived. The motion is highly privileged in the

and is privileged in the Senate and is not debatable. The motion is not subject to amendment, or to a motion to postpone, or to a motion to proceed to the consideration of other business. A motion to reconsider the vote by which the motion is agreed to or disagreed to shall not be in order. If a motion to proceed to the consideration of the bill is agreed to, the respective House shall immediately proceed to consideration of the bill without intervening motion, order, or other business, and the bill shall remain the unfinished business of the respective House until disposed of.

text.#text: On or after the third day after the date on which the committee to which such a bill is referred has reported, or has been discharged (under

Debate on the bill, and on all debatable motions and appeals in connection therewith, shall be limited to not more than 2 hours, which shall be divided equally between those favoring and those opposing the bill. An amendment to the bill is not in order. A motion further to limit debate is in order and not debatable. A motion to postpone, or a motion to proceed to the consideration of other business, or a motion to recommit the bill is not in order. A motion to reconsider the vote by which the bill is agreed to or disagreed to is not in order.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and a single quorum call at the conclusion of the debate if requested in accordance with the rules of the appropriate House, the vote on final passage of the bill shall occur.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: Immediately following the conclusion of the debate on a bill described in

, as the case may be, to the procedure relating to a bill described in
shall be decided without debate.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: Appeals from the decisions of the Chair relating to the application of the rules of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: If, before the passage by one House of a bill of that House described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:e/p:1/sp:B/cl:ii

text.#text: The bill of the other House shall not be referred to a committee and may not be considered in the House receiving it except in the case of final passage as provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of the House receiving the bill—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: With respect to a bill described in
the procedure in that House shall be the same as if no bill had been received from the other House; but
the vote on final passage shall be on the bill of the other House.
Upon disposition of the bill received from the other House, it shall no longer be in order to consider the bill that originated in the receiving House.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the days on which either House of Congress is not in session because of an adjournment of more than three days to a day certain shall be excluded in the computation of a period.

text.#text: For purposes of
This section is enacted by

header.#text: Rules of the senate and house

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and

, respectively, and as such it is deemed a part of the rules of each House, respectively, but applicable only with respect to the procedure to be followed in that House in the case of a bill described in
, and it supersedes other rules only to the extent that it is inconsistent with such rules; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Agency Simplification and Efficiency Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the

with full recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change the rules (so far as relating to the procedure of that House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in the case of any other rule of that House.
